title: Why does Mordekaiser have 325 ms?
body:
325 ms, really, why? He has no escape mechanism, no crowd control, and is melee range. I mean Vladimir has 330 move speed, and has W(sanguine pool) to escape. Viktor has 335 ms, and W(gravity field). AND they are both ranged! As it stands, Mordekaiser is one of the easiest champions to gank in League of Legends. Again, he has melee range, no cc, no escape, and a horrible 325 ms. As someone who plays Mordekaiser mid, I have 2 suggestions:
1 = Raise his ms to 340
2 = Boost his defenses (Maybe a bit more starting health, armor?)
I don't think he needs a major rehaul. I'm not happy with his W, but otherwise I like the place his in right now. He just needs to be tankier and have more ms, to mitigate the fact that he has no cc / escape, and as such is the easiest gank target.

replies.body: He has 325 ms because his internet is very bad.

Cause he is meant to be a kiteable juggernaut. He also has his W to give him ms.

It would be a nice change to have BETTER FUCKING BASE STATS BECOZ FUKIN KHA';ZIX HAS BETTER BASE STATS THAN A BRUISER
But he gets kited BY juggernaughts. D:

That until he gets his Rylais xd
Which might explain why he has such a low base movement speed. Other juggernauts like Garen and Darius don't have Frozen Mallet as a core item on them, instead they have higher base movement speed and some sort of way (Garen specifically) to get into the face of the enemy carries, but Riot probably knew Rylais will stay core on him (as it was before the rework as I recall) when he has no gapclosing mechanic, and thus they might've thought that if he had that movement speed as garen or Darius have it would be pretty harder to escape him when he builds Rylais in every game probably.

By the way, I think the t3 boots / boot enchantments were still existing in game when they released juggernauts rework, and actually rushing one of these enchantments on mordekaiser to help him reach a target could cause a very deadly situation for his opponents who probably did not rush any enchantment. (I believe many morde players would give up 500 or so gold for that alacrity or furor straight after Rylais even to be able to reach their target easily, but that would end up with morde being too fast than intended once he tagged someone with his ult and permaslowed them for that 10 seconds)

Whilst this is true, lane is usually already won by someone before first items are completed.

I agree with the enchantments; I bought them all the time.

Rylai's is only core because of his movement speed. If Darius had the same movement speed and no slow, Frozen Mallet WOULD be core on him.

If I didn't need Rylai's, I wouldn't take it half as much.

(It wasn't core before rework, but a small group of mains liked to buy it.)

What you're saying is not wrong, but the main problem as presented in this thread (immobility) of morde is almost irrelevant to how well he does in the top lane for example, when not against ranged champions like Quinn (who punishes any melee champions, even riven who is utterly mobile), because then his job is to survive lane phase and the ideal goal is to win trades and gain control of the lane (which he can do pretty well thanks to his passive, q w e self explanatory but they basically deal a lot of damage, much more than other melee champions can - usually because they have cc/gap closers which in exchange forces them to be weaker than him), and yea usually in melee skirmishes it's not about how much base movement speed a champion has. Mordekaiser also has a relatively high attack range, and can set up his third q decently on enemy minions before forcing a trade, assuming 
played correctly.
(As I remember every mordekaiser I've seen before the rework had Rylais :D)

His Laning prior to Rylai's is hilarious when using Stormraider's, but all of my Diamond opponents are aware of that little trick. Sad times.

I mainly get sad about the movement speed when against other juggernaughts. I get a good trade, they simply walk away. They get a good trade, I have to absorb two or three more auto's if they orb walk correctly. The movement speed isn't so noticeable in huge teamfights, but in delicate top lane trades, it's the biggest difference I felt between old and new Morde.

(I rocked the Luden's Echo and Void Staff Morde back in the day. Tanks and squishies, beware! There were a few high ELO Morde players that took Rylai's, but not as a rushed item. Most of them used the DFG build, or Luden's when DFG was removed. Rylai's was a nice mid or late game option when you needed more health to survive getting bursted. That's what I'd like Rylai's to be again: situational, not staple. It wasn't taken for the slow. Pre-buff Rylai's slow on AOE attacks weren't worth anything.)

I'm off for now, but I've enjoyed discussing my favourite champion with someone who actually structures their opinions. It's a shame we're on different servers.

I think the right buff on him could be a slow on each proc of his Q (not buffing his movement speed). This way he'll still be as kite-able, but will be greatly rewarded if he actually manages to get to his target, while also not having other juggernauts kiting him in lane trades, as you said.
his W grants movement speed. he never has to actually be in combat so out of combat bonuses are pretty great on him

His W is horrible. Its way to situational, requires an ally in front of you, and lasts 4 seconds. The passive component is the best part of it, but otherwise weak, especially if you decide to go on a solo lane.

the passive is actually the worst part of it because it's pretty much 24/7 pointless unless you're duo laning.

Hard CC counters him hard (if he can't get his passive up, then he's squishy enough to die instantly. He's top 8 lowest hp at lvl 18.) His q required you to be in melee range. His W requires an ally in FRONT of you (and you are generally going to be the front line), and lasts 4 seconds. He's E range is medium, with a short cast animation. What exactly would make him utterly strong?
He saw some play before his W experience nerf, in bot lane, but that was purely for his level advantage. Where is Mordekaiser now? Why aren't we seeing him?
His weakness is his need to be in the front line to be effective. His weakness is his kite-ability, and his lack of escape mechanisms and any crowd control. We shouldn't add to that the worst in game mobility. Please play 10 ranked mordekaiser games, and come back to me.

* "He sees 0 play in the competitive scene" - how much I love hearing this. competetive scene is worlds different than what you play as League, and the fact that one champion isn't picked in the competetive scene doesn't make it weak, bad, or not viable.

* "Out of all the league champions, he is the easiest to gank" - an intended weakness of mordekaiser. Just like {{champion:122}}, he is easy to gank, does it make darius bad? arguably, but if darius was that bad he wouldn't have been banned that much.

* "Hard CC counters him hard" - pointless claim, hard CC counters every champion.

* "His W requires an ally in FRONT of you (and you are generally going to be the front line), and lasts 4 seconds." - That makes him work really good with divers and tanks. 4 seconds can be a whole teamfight in League.

* "What exactly would make him utterly strong?" - his damage output is ridiculous, so increasing his mobility in the way that it would be much harder to peel him off would offer no counterplay against his damage. How good would you feel if you couldnt kite him as an adc?

* "Where is Mordekaiser now? Why aren't we seeing him?" - In fact I have seen him in some recent high elo games. You don't see Urgot often, does it make him a weak or buff-needing champion? absolutely not.

* "His weakness is his need to be in the front line to be effective. His weakness is his kite-ability, and his lack of escape mechanisms and any crowd control. We shouldn't add to that the worst in game mobility. " - Kite-ability, lack of escape mechanisms and worst in game mobility are 3 different mashed up versions of one weaknss - immobility. Some champions lack crowd control, which can be compromised by {{item:3116}} and {{item:3146}} that make sticking up to a target on him almost as effective as hard CC. Some champions lack mobility, which can also be compromised by {{item:3116}} {{item:3146}} {{summoner:6}} {{summoner:4}} {{summoner:3}} (specifically on him) as while they might find getting to a target troublesome, once they reach it, it is not likely to escape them.


* all that and we didnt even speak about his strengths. all it takes for him to change the game's tide is point and click r on an enemy champion, and with a decent followup from team, the game shifts from 5v5 to 6v4. his ultimate is really really strong in forcing objectives, it is very hard to duel him if you're not able to kite him (and thats exactly what you're asking to do - increase his mobility and reduce effectiveness of kiting against him, adcs will get 1shot by his q alone), and he is not that easy to take down as well, considering he is equal in gold with his opponents. + once again, his damage is absolutely insane.

Mordekaiser is not an ideal pick for carrying right now, accept it and get over it. Every champion has been through times where it wasn't a top tier pick compared to other champions.

And as JIDF also said, he is in a pretty good spot right now, especially with the first blood tower when he has so strong objective control (having an over 2k hp ghost that deals over 200 damage per hit already by 10 minutes is really underwhelming right?)
He is very strong, just not an ideal pick against every single team composition and champion of League.
He might lack mobility (which again can be compromised by items runes and masteries) but he also can stick to a target pretty well. Once you have rylais and tag someone with the ult its much easier to get to them and 100-0 them with your q-e in case theyre a squishy.

You said he's not so tanky, but with his passive (especially with that e which has just about 5 seconds cd that recovers his shield extremely well in teamfights) and just {{item:3116}} he becomes far more tanky than some other mid laners become, and very hard to assassinate if built correctly, especially compared to some other carries.

Let's be honest, he needs a complete rebalance, 'cos he's even more of a feed or feast champion than the old Morde.

MS and base stats up, remove or weaken that absurdly high heal on W (or replace with resistances. The resistances on previous W worked fine).

Make him so that Rylai's isn't a staple item. Morde's power is directly linked to the state of Rylai's whilst other champions can just change to better items when adjustments are made. For the same reason, Stormraider's Surge being used by most high ELO Morde mains is weird, and I'm sure not the way he was meant to be designed.

Dragon? I don't know how Riot feels about dragon, but I think it's utterly ridiculous!

Kind regards

Underwhelming. Ok.

Your points are crossing the conclusions of what Azrael's saying (and I value his opinion about morde more than yours for various reasons)
You're not happy with his W, I don't think it's because it's too strong assuming you're in for buffing morde, yet Azrael is claiming that the W is one of the less balanced tools on his kit right now.
Besides, you want higher base stats on him so he won't be such an easy handling target, yet the mobility you complain about is the most exploitable on team fights, and not in Laning phase (don't even try saying that against ranged champions it is, because it is literally how it should be - ranged champion should bully melee champion in lane, it's one of the whole ideas of melee and ranged stats), except the fact that much more crucial things that come into consideration into whether to gank a lane or not is first and foremost how you act in lane (I would never gank anyone who are near their turret in early levels - which are the weakest points of mordekaiser due to his low base stats and the fact that his damaging abilities get ridiculously stronger the later the game it is), and another thing that comes into my mind before gainking is kill potential, which is totally screwed by the fact that when ganked, mordekaiser has a high chance to land his E on 2 targets and recover 30% of his shield (when e is just level 1 - and people are maxing his E first under some circumstances), leave the fact that his w heals him. So yea you're asking for higher base stats to make him not as much as an appealing target to ganking but in fact he has a lot of tools to survive a gank that champions with escapes (like zed or ezreal) that anyways can be predicted and countered, don't have. 
And we're still not finished, getting ganked has to do a lot with your play style as I mentioned, if you're constantly pushing and you're someone like morde Ofc you'll get ganked, and you should take that into consideration and perhaps not play as aggressive or whatever in lane, knowing that your champion has no escapes, in order to prevent that ganks incoming. That is called knowing your champions strengths and weaknesses, being able to understand what they truly mean and change your play style according to them, in order to perform the best on your champion.
Written by a jungle main so you better take the tips about ganking to your heart.

No, simply because I have responded to all your points, yet your ''locked'' into your opinion. You can't help it. Opinions are strong things. Yet my research has unveiled quite a number of things about Mordekaiser:
1 - He's a juggernaut, yet squishier then champions like Soraka.
2 - Unlike Soraka, he isn't meant for the back lane. He's attacks are melee, his q is melee, his w is melee range, and his e is 675 (which isn't allot for a skill that originates from the champ), and his ulti is 650 range. You need to be in the front line to deal any dmg.
3 - Build Rylais you say? I do, every game. And its unhealthy forcing an item onto a champion. Its unhealthy forcing champions to build a certain path, because they need to make up for an overwhelming weakness. Build diversity is an important part of the game.
4 - He was meant to be immobile. Really? Why give him any movement speed at all is he was meant to be immobile. His base stats don't make up for it (Nr. 8 lowest health pool!).
a - The fact that he was meant to be immobile doesn't mean its the best decision for the champion. Compare it with nautilus, same movement speed, but you get WAY better defensive stats, and you can use q to move around, plus you have tons of CC. You can R-E-Q and get away from a bad fight. With Mordekaiser, if a fight goes bad, that's it, you're dead.
b - The fact that he was meant to be immobile doesn't mean he needs to have 325 ms. Darius is another immobile champion, and nobody complains about his 340 ms. Immobile means he has no escape mechanism, no dash, no ms speed.
c - The fact that his immobile should be compensated for in other areas. Its no in his base stats, its not in his dmg output, he has no crowd control? Where is this compensation you speak of?
5 - I will always value the opinion of someone who plays Mordekaiser, as opposed to people who haven't. The same way I would rather have heart surgery at the hands of a doctor who's done it 20 times already (ranked!) as opposed to a novice who did it twice on a training dummy (normal!). You simply have no idea what you're saying.
But I guess its more important for you to win this argument, instead of actually taking at look at the state of mordekaiser, and trying to promote changes that would be beneficial for the game. Where is the compensation I speak or? His damage is insane, he is much more tanky with his shield than other champions even though he had lower base stats, especially because he can recover his shield much more than most champions can naturally recover the +30-70 base health they get over him in beginnings.
He also has a stupid amount of lane/map pressure with his ultimate, especially when now dragons are so prioritized and he is likely to get his hand on one and be able to force a tower with it if a minimum of 2 champions with good clear without risking being out of position appear in the lane and take it down, which applies global pressure.
Also his teamfight potential is very strong and might cause very impactful consequences. 
Let's imagine they have Janna Ezreal as an enemy bot lane, which you know you have no chance to reach. Does that make you useless, like it would to many assassins/champions whose primary role is to get on top of enemy carry and kill it, and are just bad picks if they can't fulfill their role?
